name: Simply Legos
description:
This is my submission for the 2021 GMTK game jam where the theme is "Joined Together". Those two words are the heart of what makes Legos so magical so it only made sense to make a game like this (I was also had no other good ideas but we're gonna ignore that.) There's no objective, just like with real Legos, the fun comes from getting creative. I kept the interface minimal so you can easily go full screen and take a screenshot to save your work.

How to play:

Mouse wheel to zoom in and out.

Hold the left mouse button (without clicking a block) to pan the view with your mouse.

Press "z" to center the view if you ever pan too far. 

Press "i" to toggle icons to more easily see connection types.

Left click on an existing block to place it in your hand.

Right click anywhere to open the menu. From here there are a few categories you can click through to select different block types and place new ones in your hand. There's also a button for selecting the color you want to use and a helpful button for quickly creating a copy of the last block you used.

With a block in your hand:

Left click to place a block. Blocks can be placed in the air if no others are nearby, but to connect them you need to snap a positive connector to a negative connector on another block or vice versa.

Right click to delete the block.

Hold "c" and move your mouse wheel to change its color.

Press "r" to rotate the block 90 degree clock wise, or hold shift while pressing "r" to rotate it 90 degrees counter clockwise.
